name: Infinito Winemaker's Selection Malbec 2018
description: Grapy berry aromas come with a note of asphalt, while this is racy and braced by firm acidity. Plum, cassis and raspberry flavors are more red than black, while this Malbec from a top vintage finishes with pulling tannins that lend a rubbing texture. Drink through 2024.  Score - 92. (Michael Schachner, Wine Enthusiast, Sept. 1, 2021)

name: JP Chenet Advent Calendar - Sparkling Wine
description: This super-fun gift pack is the perfect seasonal gift for the wine enthusiast in your life. Creatively crafted by JP Chenet, this is a very festive advent calendar with a mix of 24 mini, 200 mL bottles of sparkling wines - white, rosé. One different wine behind each door. One discovery every day!

name: Jackson-Triggs Entourage with Icewine Dosage 2016
description: When an Ontario Sparkling wine tells you its dosage was acted out as an Icewine finish and then the first nose is all Icewine well, then you've know its maker got it right. The facts are facts, of ripe peach, a hint of longan or litchi and the sugary sweetness of just bitten into, dripping autumn fruit. Proper replay and sparkling acidity into an even sweeter finish. Just a moment of lemon bitters and then smooth sailing. Surely for those who like high quality, high-end sweet fizz, like a white version of top shelf Brachetto d'Acqui. Drink date: 2020-2023. Score - 90. (Michael Godel, winealign.com, April 8, 2020)

name: Unwined Smooth White
description: This exciting new brand by Colio is a crowd-pleaser. It offers simplicity and great taste that is easy to understand and enjoy. Refreshing and fruity with aromas and flavours of yellow plum, herbs, pastry and pear. Dry with a hint of sweetness that balances nicely with soft acidity. Pairs well with salty snacks or tacos.

name: Stel + Mar Premium Red Wine
description: Was: $4.95 An accessible red wine in an environmentally-friendly and convenient format. This is bursting with notes of raspberry, blackberry and cherry, followed by hints of chocolate and vanilla. Medium-bodied and fruity with a long, silky finish.

name: Stel + Mar Premium White Wine
description: Was: $4.95 Stel+Mar is a hip Canadian-owned company that is offering premium-quality wine in a convenient, fully recyclable can. Premium White is an un-oaked chardonnay from Mendocino, California, brimming with ripe orchard fruit and lively citrusy flavours; chill and serve with your favourite casual fare.

name: Union Wine Alchemist Pinot Noir 2021
description: This is attractive, with wild strawberries, cocoa-dusted cherries, walnuts and nutmeg. Juicy and pristine on the palate, with medium body, crunchy acidity and sleek cherries and raspberries in the middle. It's both delicate and firm, with a flavorful blue-fruit finish. Drink or hold [until 2029]. Score - 93. (jamessuckling.com, May 9, 2023)

name: The Winery of Good Hope Full Berry Fermentation Pinotage 2021
description: This wine comes from two sites, one in northern Stellenbosch with sandy, decomposed quartz and granite soils, and the other in the weathered granite soils of Voor Paardeberg. Destemmed but not crushed, the grapes underwent spontaneous wild fermentation in stainless steel with the intent of encouraging a less tannic style of Pinotage and emphasizing the wine's vibrant cherry, black fruit, spice and minerality.

name: Robertson Winery Chapel Red
description: Situated in the Robertson wine region, in South Africa's Western Cape Province, Robertson Winery has been making wine since 1941. This cabernet-merlot blend is soft and extra dry, with ample cassis, smoke, cedar and bell pepper flavours. Suitable for every occasion, and the perfect pour with ribs, steaks or hearty stews.

name: WineSoju
description: Kim's Winery & Distillery focuses on traditional South Korean beverages produced right here in Toronto. A unique fusion of lush Niagara-sourced red wine and corn-based Korean Soju-styled spirit; look for soft red berry flavours and gentle grain aromas. Pair with sweet and tangy Asian-inspired dishes, like grilled Galbi.

name: Wine Brandy Sarajishvili 3*
Vale da Mata Red Wine 2018
description: A family project in Lisboa has produced a richly dense wine, solid with black fruits while having a cool backbone. The wine is finely and elegantly balanced. Drink from 2022. Editors' Choice. Score - 92. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, Dec. 31, 2021)

name: Fresita Orange Sunset Sparkling Wine
description: This fruity sparkling wine is the perfect aperitif. Anticipate dominant notes of orange with an underlying hint of strawberry. The fruity palate leads you to a palate-cleansing finish. Pairs nicely with fresh fruit salad, chocolate-based desserts or Cajun-inspired chicken skewers.

name: Henkell Dealcoholized Sparkling Wine
description: With a long history of producing sparklers made for celebrating, Henkell's newest addition will have even more people raising a glass. This dealcoholized sparkling wine pours a pale straw, displays a fine mousse, and has honeyed notes of apple and lemon zest. With less than 1% alcohol by volume, pair it with brunch fare.

name: Bordertown Vineyards and Estate Winery Syrah 2018
description: The wines matured between 12 and 18 months in American oak. It is a muscular, brooding red with aromas of plum, prune, cherry and black pepper. The palate has layers of dark fruit with a hint of black pepper. Score - 90. (johnschreiner.blogspot.com, March 18, 2021)

name: Paulett Wines Watervale Semillon 2019
description: This is a delicious mid-weighted and vibrant wine. Gently soapy of texture with riffs of lemon oil, quince and lemongrass splayed across a lattice of thirst-slaking acidity, saline and slaty. Like biting into a melody of ripe citrus. Long and crunchy. Drink by: 2027. Score - 94. (Ned Goodwin, winecompanion.com.au, Aug. 1, 2020)

name: Tyrrell's Winemaker Select Vat 8 Shiraz/Cabernet 2018
description: The beauty of medium bodied Shiraz and depth of Cabernet all parcelled up cleverly. A tense number early, this found its groove a few days on. Initially I had a taste but parked it returning to see gorgeous butterfly emerge from the chrysalis. The black fruits from the Cabernet (10%) slide underneath the juicy Shiraz with absolute ease. So fine and measured, the fruit seems to float through the mouth before digging its claws in at the death. A subtle hint of meatiness with puffs of red Hunter Valley earth add to its beauty. Super fine tannins and exotic spices refuse to leave on what seems a forever length. This is brilliant! Drink to eight years. Score - 95. (qwinereviews.com, Nov. 1, 2020)

name: The Hare Wine Co. Frontier Collection Pinot Grigio 2019
description: Crafted in a light, bright, zesty style, this wine is loaded with mouth-watering, snappy citrus flavours. Ideal for sipping on a hot day, it will pair easily with a range of seafood appetizers, snacks and salads but will also be a fine option for chicken.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars Hand of Time Red Blend 2019
Red House Wine Co. Cabernet Merlot VQA
description: A Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot blend from Niagara-sourced fruit and wood aged for six months. Plenty of strawberries and raspberry fruit flavours with hints of vanilla, medium-bodied. Silky tannins follow through to a lengthy finish. Perfect with grilled meats or try with gourmet portobello mushroom burgers.

name: Grove Estate Wines Hilltops Shiraz 2018
description: It's well fruited, it uses reduction to positive effect, it's woodsy and clovey but at heart it's black-cherried and ripe. Fine tannins, impeccable balance and a satisfying finish complete a quality picture. Drink by: 2028. Special Value. Score - 94. (Campbell Mattinson, winecompanion.com.au, Aug. 1, 2020)

name: Campbell Kind Wine Kautz Family Cabernet Sauvignon 2019
description: This Cabernet is a selection from Steven Campbell's Kind Wines project, wherein all wines are made using eco-friendly methods. Crafted by the Kautz family of Ironstone fame, this California Cabernet employs sustainable-farming practices and carbon offsets. Expect a polished wine brimming with cassis and gentle spice notes and pour with lamb stew.

name: La Bélière Red Organic Wine 2019
description: (Translated from the German): Cherry red with light violet reflections. Intense aromas of dates, balsamic and dark chocolate burst into the nose. Above all lingers a discreet hint of preserved blueberries. The tannin is well-defined in the mouth and the alcohol robust. The medium acidity lightens the intense flavours. Score - 90. (Ulrich Sautter, falstaff.com, Feb. 17, 2021)

name: Dugladze Tsolikouri White Wine 2018
description: Aromas of lemon and petrol and a touch of baking spice prepare the taste buds for flavors of lemon, orange and espresso bean. This wine is bright on the palate and offers a drawn-out yet zippy finish. Score - 88. (Mike DeSimone, Wine Enthusiast, Nov. 2019)

name: Campbell Kind Wine Tawse Riesling 2019
description: This riesling, from the Tawse owned Limestone Ridge Vineyard, is certified organic and vegan. It is a single tank from a single vineyard of 25-year-old vines that were picked and kept separate the whole time. It's truly a limited edition wine with incredible minerality and is bursting with notes of green apple, grapefruit and orange zest. Balanced and ever-refreshing, this lovely wine is quite ready now, but feel free to hold onto it for several years if you're into collecting well-made riesling. Hard to beat the quality-to-price ratio on this one. (Carmelo Giardina, vineroutes.com)

name: Aberfeldy 18 Paulliac French Red WIne Cask Finish
Bottega 0 Rose Non-Alcoholic Wine
description: This vibrant sparkling rosé is low alc. yet doesn't compromise on flavour. Anticipate inviting aromas and flavours of ripe red berries and a delicate floral note. Light-bodied, fruity, and moderately sweet with a refreshingly crisp finish. Pair with fresh fruit salad or enjoy it as an aperitif.

name: Garage Wine Co. Las Higueras Vineyard Lot 112 Old Bush-Head Vines Cabernet Franc 2019
description: The change in the wine has resulted in a 2019 Las Higueras Vineyard bottled in a lighter Burgundy shaped bottle to reflect the new profile, after they worked over five years to revive the old vines that 'had been overstressed for many years. New techniques and tools like a flail mower (vs blade mower) make it possible to chip/mulch everything, including last year's cane and dung, and incorporate it all into the soil. We no longer plow this vineyard. The life in soil is more full of life/microbes and with cover crops that retain moisture better. The walk behind two-wheel tractor is the only way to get between the old narrow rows to trim cover crops. Just part of our ongoing work to redefine what 'cultivate' means and with balance on the farm grow tastier fruit...' The 2019 seems to reflect a warmer and drier year, possibly with a shorter cycle. Initially, the wine doesn't seem as balanced and refined as the 2018, especially in the texture of the tannins, but with time it blossomed and didn't stop changing in the glass; after a couple of hours, it was simply spectacular. It has similar parameters as the 2018, but ultimately there is an extra spark of acidity here. Drink date: 2021-2028. Score - 95. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, Aug. 31, 2021)

name: Bardet Dirty South Lil' Wine 2016
description: Aromas of stewed blackberries, prunes, chocolate, mushrooms and walnuts. Medium- to full-bodied with firm, chewy tannins. Plenty of rich walnut and chocolate character. Compact, chewy finish. 60% merlot and 40% cabernet franc. Drink now or hold. Score - 90. (jamessuckling.com, March 31, 2022)

name: Redline Red Wine 2018
description: The 2018 Red Blend Redline is a blend of 65% Cabernet Sauvignon, 15% Syrah, 13% Zinfandel, 6% Petite Sirah and 1% Malbec. It has a deep ruby-purple color and is scented of cassis and crushed red and black cherries with notes of cedar, dried herbs, pencil shavings and sweet spices. The palate is full-bodied with lush, ripe, baking spice-laced fruits, finishing dense. Fans of fruit-driven, oaky red blends will enjoy this. Drink date: 2020-2030. Score - 91. (Erin Brooks, robertparker.com, July 23, 2020)

name: Ghost Pines Winemaker's Blend Pinot Noir 2018
description: Burly and big for Pinot Noir, this wine offers up floral rose petal notes with rich black fruit, cherry, vanilla, coffee, chocolate and spice. It's plush and generous, with a long finish. Pair with portobello mushroom burgers, pulled pork or grilled salmon.

name: Thirty Bench Winemaker's Blend Riesling
description: This wine is from the Beamsville Bench, which is one of Niagara's best spots for growing Riesling. It's a classic, featuring flowers, citrus, refreshing acidity and a fine minerality. Makes any meal special, from simple ham-and-brie sandwiches to foie gras.

name: Elyse Winery C'est Si Bon California Red Blend 2019
description: C'est Si Bon blends Rhone varietals with Merlot producing a lovely, medium-bodied and amazingly well balanced wine with lively fruit, soft tannins and bright acidity.  A combination of four unique vineyard sites with each parcel adding to the layers of this wine and its polished, approachable character.

name: Old World Winery Two Rock Block 2009
description: This smells rich and foresty with blackberry, black cherry, dark plum, black pepper and spice. On the palate, brambly blackberry, overripe raspberry and baked plums with black spice. Bright acidity is supported by bold tannins and big dark fruit, but it comes in an elegant, low-ABV.

name: Old World Winery 1890 Block Russian River Valley 2012
description: Muscadelle, Trousseau Gris, Palomino, Mondeuse Noire, Abouriou and Zinfandel. All six varieties are picked on the same day and blended in a true field-blend style. Wild Fermentation occurs naturally. Then two years in neutral barrels, sur lie, never racked, then bottled unfined/unfiltered.

name: Garage Wine Co. Bagual Vineyard Lot 106 Dry Farmed Old Vines 2019
description: They say the 2019 Bagual Vineyard Cariñena Garnacha Monastrell is a tribute to the resilience of the plowmen farmers of the Maule who have been stewards of the vines of Caliboro since colonial times. It's marked as lot #106, as it's the 106th wine they have bottled since 2001. I left this wine in the glass for a long time, and it didn't stop changing and improving. At first, it felt a little rougher than the 2018, but it opened up and cleaned in the glass, and in the end it was as good (and perhaps better!). It reveals the more floral side of Cariñena, with low alcohol (13.5%) and notable acidity (6.33 in tartaric) and freshness (pH 3.25!), vibrant and long. These are intellectual wines that require time but are deeply satisfying. I have to say that I kept changing my mind (and my scores!) as the wines developed in the glass; they are not to be assessed quickly. They are a moving target! I think there's more complexity here than in the pure Garnacha... Drink date: 2021-2029. Score - 95+. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, Aug. 31, 2021)

name: Garage Wine Co. Bagual Vineyard Lot 79 Dry Farmed Old Vines Field-blend Grenacha 2016
description: The 2016 Bagual Vineyard Garnacha Field Blend is floral, expressive and perhaps radically different, with notes I've never found in previous vintages. It was harvested very early, because ripening was very fast, and it has great tension on the palate (it has 7.17 grams of acidity!). The bunches of Garnacha here are very small, as Garnacha can be very variable. Drink date: 2018-2026. Score - 94. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, Oct. 31, 2018)

name: Garage Wine Co. Truquilemu Vineyard Lot 108 Dry Farmed Old Vines Syrah 2019
description: Grown on the weathered granite soils of the Coastal Range in Truquilemu, this 100% syrah from young vineyards has all the character of the local reds - especially Mediterranean varieties such as carignan or this syrah - with their firm acidity, their tense, wild tannins, and the influence of the sea (about 30 kilometers away) doing its thing in a hard, vertical wine. One to cellar for at least five years. Score - 94. (Patricio Tapia, guiadescorchados.cl, 2022)

name: Garage Wine Co. Truquilemu Vineyard Lot 77 Dry Farrmed Old Vines Field-blend Carignan 2016
description: The really grand and elegant 2016 Truquilemu Vineyard starts off quite shy and takes some time to open up in the glass. They used a little more stems for the fermentation (stems are added rather than using the full clusters), as they don't like carbonic maceration. This is characterful, floral, subtle and really elegant while keeping the varietal profile. The tannins are very fine grained, and the palate feels really balanced. This has to be the stuff wine dreams are made of! Drink date: 2018-2028. Score - 97. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, Oct. 31, 2018)

name: Mullineux Straw Wine 2023
description: The 2023 Straw Wine comes from the same vineyard as usual, harvested from 45-year-old vines that produce high acidities. It underwent no malo due to the high natural concentration of malic acid during the four-week drying process on the farm. This has 335g/l residual sugar with a crucial 11g/l acidity. The bouquet is enticingly intense and beautifully defined, oozing with wild honey, quince and Clementine. The palate is impeccably balanced with a killer line of acidity that slices through the tangy honeyed fruit. Almost crystalline on the finish, it lingers long in the mouth with amazing purity. Drinking window: 2024-2055. Score - 97. (Neal Martin, vinous.com, Sept. 19, 2024)

name: Chateau Dereszla Frisco Sparkling Wine 2020
description: This is a very tasty semi-dry aereated white wine with pleasant bubbles. Very refreshing. Made of 2 native Tokaj wine grapes (Furmint and Harslevelu). Best enjoyed chilled.

name: Benaiga Natural Wine Carignan 2021
description: This juicy, bright wine was fermented with wild yeast in stainless steel to preserve the fine fruit tones. It shows ripe red and black fruit, dark chocolate, good intensity and concentration and soft, caressing tannins. This will cellar for another 2+ years and will be great tonight with massaman curry, grilled mushroom burgers or ribs.

name: Jeremy Wine Company Chocolate Fortified Wine
description: Tempranillo, Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca, Souzao, Bastardo, Tinta Cao, Zinfandel, and Petite Sirah. Silky chocolate on the palate with intense complex fruit flavours. Natural residual grape sugars complement the unsweetened cocoa that is blended into the port-style wine.

name: Jeremy Wine Company Shenandoah Valley Tempranillo 2018
description: Blackberry, dark cherry and dried blueberries intertwined with aromas of rose petal, cedar, dried herbs and dark chocolate. Plush, full bodied tannins on the palate, finishing with rich plum, vanilla and cinnamon spice. Single vineyard: Spencer located in Amador County.

name: Jeremy Wine Company Lodi Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
description: Clements Hills of Lodi AVA. Dense, dark cherry, blackberry, black currant, big soft tannins that wrap around your mouth with lingering elements of toasted vanilla and spice. A wine to make many Bordeaux producers jealous of this micro-climate. A generous wine for entertaining & lounging.

name: Jeremy Wine Company Lodi Barbera 2019
description: On the nose vivid lush cherry and black fruit mingle on the nose accented with soft aromatic hints of floral and sweet oak. Lush on the palate, with big soft tannins and dark ripe cherry finishing in lingering vanilla and cocoa.

name: Angels Gate Snowangel Icewine Dosage Sparkling Riesling
description: Angels Gate is one of Ontario's most renowned producers of sparkling wines, and this is a new addition to their stable. It's made from Riesling harvested from a single vineyard and finished with a dose of Riesling Icewine. Expect a sweet-and-tangy interplay of citrus preserves, poached pear and applesauce, and pair with seafood tempura, spicy pork entrees or fruit desserts.

name: Christopher Michael Northwest Winemakers Pinot Noir 2022
description: A collaborative effort from two goliath Oregon producers: Christopher Michael Wines and Underwood. Crafted to fuel wanderlust, this earthy Pinot Noir offers aromas of ripe red cherry, coffee, freshly turned earth and hints of leather. Bring a loved one for a nice hike and open this delicious red while you admire the scenery.

name: Barreau OG Orange Wine Sémillon 2020
description: Sourced from 80-year-old vines and fermented with wild yeasts, this 100% Sémillon saw 40 days of skin contact; a process typically reserved for red wines. When applied to white wines, this maceration introduces the deep colour and unique flavour profile that distinguishes orange wines. This wine shows orange citrus, apple and peach, with good weight and texture. Pair with grilled veggies and grilled pork.

name: JSC Sarajishvili 5 Stars Wine Brandy
description: This intense, fruity brandy is made by ageing eaux-de-vie in oak barrels. It has notes of grilled almonds, grape, and oak spice. Finely balanced.

name: 20000 Leguas Skin Contact Amber Wine 2020
description: This blend of Chardonnay, Viura and Verdejo saw 10-14 days of skin contact during fermentation; a process that gives orange wine its unique colour. The 20,000 Leguas is vibrant and fun, with lifted aromatics, tropical fruit, dried orange, apple and hazelnut. Try it with caramelized vegetables, or Georgian eggplant rolls with walnut filling.

name: Kozlovic Teran Red Wine
description: Deep violet colour. Intense on the nose with plenty of ripe black cherries, dried prunes and dark chocolate. Smoke and oak to add complexity. Dry on the palate, medium bodied with good tannic grip. Needs time to open. This is a perfect companion with grilled meat.

name: Garage Wine Co. Pais Single Ferment Series 2021
description: Garage wine Co. is on a mission to revive one of Chile's most-planted grape varieties known as Pias.  A mineral-laden wine with notes of  wild, scrubby red fruits, accents of graphite & floral notes. Showing bright acidity & earthy tannins, this wine offers a unique insight into this historically significant grape variety.

name: Garage Wine Co. Old Vine Pale Truquilemu Vineyard 2020
description: A cheeky light-bodied red with a very tasty palate: vivid notes of pomegranate, cranberries, wild strawberries and citrus with herbs that literally makes you hunger for food. Oily on the palate with crunchy berries plus linear acidity to match mid-weight phenolics. Carignan and Mataro blend.

name: Gemtree Wines Uncut Shiraz 2019
description: Uncut Shiraz is generous, layered, bright and textural. The aromas are intense and complex of blueberry, mulberry and spiced vanilla oak. Uncut is a rich and pure shiraz, the lively fruit flavours are polished and cocooned by natural oak flavours and balanced acidity, all hallmarks of our house Shiraz.

name: Il Paradiso di Frassina Moz Art Wine Brunello di Montalcino 2017
description: Aromas of dried flowers, black cherries and dried strawberries follow through to a medium to full body with very fine tannins that coat the mouth. From organically grown grapes. Fresh, bright and very drinkable now, but will be even better in 2023. Score - 95. (jamessuckling.com, Nov. 4, 2021)

name: The Flying Winemaker Syrah 2019
description: Dark red, purple hue.  The nose is rich and lifted, with notes of violets, gamey meats and eucalypt.  The palate is generous with cherry cola and toasty oak.  The tannins are firm with hints of cool climate spice on the finish.

name: Black Hills Estate Winery Bona Fide 2020
description: This wine is built around Merlot and includes Syrah, Malbec and more. It's aged for over a year in French oak barriques. The result is a layered, complex affair that offers juicy plum, cherry and blackberry along with touches of graphite and cracked black pepper. Savour with roasted meats, game or firm cheeses.

name: Osawa Wines Prestige Collection Sauvignon Blanc Hawkes Bay 2019
description: It's fabulously complex and engaging on the nose showing grapefruit, crunchy apple, lime peel and flinty aromas, leading to a wonderfully weighted palate delivering vibrant fruit intensity together with richly textured mouthfeel, finishing impressively long and structured. Score: 94, Sam Kim, www.wineorbit.co.nz

name: Osawa Wines Prestige Collection Pinot Noir Hawkes Bay 2018
description: Immensely complex and engaging, the wine shows dark berry, charcuterie, dried herb, mushroom and toasted almond characters on the nose. The concentrated palate delivers flowing mouthfeel and refined texture, well supported by seamlessly woven tannins. Impressive and satisfying. Score: 96, Sam Kim, www.wineorbit.co.nz

name: Signature Wines Sector Adelaide Hills Tempranillo 2019
description: On the nose, spice with dark fruit notes.  Rich full red colour.  A full flavoured wine exhibiting savoury fruit and oak characters with great tannins which are integrated well to contribute to a long and lingering finish.  Serve at room temperature with grilled foods and Spanish tapas.

name: Barossa Valley Wine Company Gravel Track Grenache/Syrah/Mourvèdre 2019
description: 'Gravel Track' pays tribute to the long gravel-and-limestone track that winds its way through this winery's historic 60-year-old Farms Vineyard. Look for intense red cherry, plum, licorice and vanilla on the way to a silky yet persistent finish, and pour with pork roast.[Australian Wine Showcase did not include a tasting note.] Score - 95. (Australian Wine Showcase, June 2021)

name: Wine Art Techni Alipias Red Blend 2019
description: A red with plum and berry, with some walnut and balsamic character. Medium body. Medium, round tannins and a juicy finish. Drink now. Score - 91. (jamessuckling.com, Oct. 5, 2022)

name: Thirty Bench Winemaker's Rosé
description: Niagara's climate encourages wines with a driving fresh acidity, and this superb rosé from one of the region's most renowned producers is a mouth-watering example. It shows lifted, brightly articulated cherry, strawberry, melon and spice, with refined structure. A wine that will enhance any meal. [The National Wine Awards of Canada did not include a tasting note.] Score - 90. (National Wine Awards of Canada, 2022)

name: Hess Select Treo Winemaker's Blend 2019
description: The Treo's blend varies vintage to vintage depending on the qualities of the season. The 2019 is Petite Sirah with Syrah, Zinfandel, Merlot and a small dash of Malbec. It's rich and full, with a mix of red and black fruit, savoury herbs and spice. This will be great tonight with steak, roast lamb or roast beef and will continue to evolve for another 3-5 years.

name: Paleokerisio Orange Semi-Sparkling Wine
description: A very unique orange wine that is semi-sparkling and semi-dry. Orange in colour with copper hues. Complex aromas of apple, butter and baking spices such as cinnamon and cloves. The palate maintains the aromas with sweet cherry and vanilla coming through with refreshing bubbles that highlight the uniqueness of this wine.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars Karia Chardonnay 2019
description: Apple tart with some stone and toffee aromas, as well as some flint, following through to a medium-to full-bodied, tight and compact palate with some creaminess. Tight finish. Drink or hold. Score - 92. (jamessuckling.com, July 5, 2021)

name: Wine Art Estate Techni Alipias White Blend 2023
description: The combination of Sauvignon Blanc and Assyrtiko produces a fruity and splendidly aromatic wine, of a clear pale yellow colour with greenish reflections. The nose is intense and fresh, a blend of citrus and mango. The clean crispness in the mouth is enhanced by a buttery touch.

name: Wine Art Estate Plano Malgousia 2021
description: 100% Malagouzia characterized by high acidity, minerality & aromas of citrus fruits, white flowers & bergamot orange. A full bodied wine with refreshing acidity & long finish. Worth a taste!!

name: Seven Hills Winery Seven Hills Vineyard Merlot 2016
description: Also deep purple-colored, the 2016 Merlot Seven Hills Vineyard (100% Merlot brought up in 45-50% new French oak) offers another level of intensity in its cassis, black cherry, toasty oak, tobacco leaf, and underbrush aromas and flavors. Deep, rich, beautifully textured, and downright sexy, it's a beautiful, sweetly fruit Merlot that does everything right. Score - 94. (jebdunnuck.com, April 11, 2019)

name: Aslanis Family Winery Malagousia Macedonia Organic 2021
description: An organic, family owned and managed winery just south of Thessaloniki, on the northwestern coast of the Aegean. 100% Malagousia. Fruity palate with pleasant acidity and aromas of white fruit and citrus. Refreshing after-taste. Vegan Friendly.

name: Aslanis Family Winery Assyrtiko Macedonia Organic 2021
description: An organic, family owned and managed winery just south of Thessaloniki, on the northwestern coast of the Aegean. Complex nose with aromas of dried citrus, bergamot peel and sweet aromas of honey and vanilla. Typically crisp on the palate with zesty acidity and mineral character.  Vegan Friendly.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars Karia Chardonnay 2020
Elementi Organic Trebbiano Orange Wine 2021
description: Though 'new' and in vogue, orange wine is in fact created via an ancient technique. The juice of white wine is given prolonged contact with the skins - a process typical of red, not white wine production - imparting deeper colour, flavours, body, and even tannins. This 100% Trebbiano will be awesome with a Mediterranean seafood stew or Moroccan lamb tagine.

name: Tzounara Winery Agape Red Agirgitiko 2020
description: Produced in Central Greece using the Agiorgitiko grape this wine shows plenty of ripe, sour red berries and gooseberry fruit. The flavours of strawberries are fresh on the palate with crisp acidity; medium bodied. Pairs well with vegetable casseroles or meat dishes.

name: Calcu Winemaker's Selection Blend 2018
description: This year, the heart of this blend is a co-fermentation of 38% cabernet franc and 15% malbec planted in a gobelet system (a kind of small bush) on the granitic and clay soils of Marchigüe, on the western side of the Colchagua Valley. The rest is 25% carmenere, 18% cabernet sauvignon, and a bit of petit verdot. This wine is all structure. Slightly austere on the nose, the palate is dominated by severe tannins that are piercing, as is usual in Marchigüe. The flavors are ripe, lush, and succulent in a wine that's big and opulent enough to consider with pork ribs. Score - 93. (Patricio Tapia, guiadescorchados.cl, 2022)

name: R Wines Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
R Wines Chardonnay 2021
Stag's Leap Wine Cellars Cask 23 Cabernet Sauvignon 2019
description: Deep purple-black in color, the 2019 Cask 23 Cabernet Sauvignon leaps with gregarious notes of warm cassis, black cherry compote and black raspberries, plus hints of rose oil, black pepper and underbrush, with touches of pencil lead and iron ore. Medium to full-bodied, the palate features a rock-solid backbone of firm, grainy tannins and bags of freshness supporting the crunchy black fruits, finishing long and minerally. Tasted as a barrel sample. Drink date: 2024-2044. Score - 94-96. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com, Nov. 30, 2021)

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars Fay Cabernet Sauvignon 2019
description: There's something so alluring and enticing about the Fay, named for Nathan Fay, who first planted Cabernet Sauvignon in what is now Stags Leap District back in 1961. It shows old-school dust, clove and graphite, with secondary hints of violet, sage and tree bark. Enjoy this wine best from 2029-2039. Cellar Selection. Score - 100. (Virginie Boone, Wine Enthusiast)

name: Changyu Moser Helan Moutain Red Wine
Thirty Bench Winemaker's Blend Cabernet Franc 2021
description: This wine is 100% Cabernet Franc, which is a variety that did exceptionally well in Niagara's 2021 vintage. With dark plum, blackcurrant, blueberry, spice, savoury herbs, and gently incorporated oak, this is not a shy wine in any respect, but it carries its power with an easy elegance and sophistication. Drink through 2030+.

name: Odem Mountain Winery Dry Red KP 2021
description: Medium-bodied with bright red berry characters like cherry and raspberry layered over savoury notes of sage and wild thyme. Pair with creamy cheeses or starchy main courses.

name: Choya Sparkling Wine
description: This wine is made from 100% Japanese premium Nanko ume, which is a kind of Japanese apricot. It offers tangy citrus and peach tones.

name: The Prisoner + FREE black wine glasses
description: From a California winery famous for its inventive red blends, The Prisoner is a captivating mix of Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah, Syrah and Charbono. Surprisingly bold and smooth, with dark chocolate, dark fruit and clove notes, it's ideal with steak. Buy three bottles and get two FREE* Spiegelau black wine glasses.

name: Poderi dal Nespoli Orange Wine 2021
description: This skin-contact white wine (hence the orange colour) is based on Trebbiano with splashes of Pinot Bianco (10%) and Sauvignon Blanc (4%). It's fermented in temperature-controlled stainless steel with the juice spending three to six months on the lees. Look for suggestions of dried flowers, star anise, juniper and dried apricots and pair with oily fish dishes or veggie tempura.

name: Concha y Toro Winemaker's Lot 148 Las Pataguas Vineyard Carmenère
description: Produced exclusively for the Canadian market, this is loaded with cassis, chocolate, licorice and cedar with a notable campfire complexity. Characterfully dense and seriously structured with plush tannins and touches of spice. Great for ribs or veal medallions.

name: Wines from Tuscany Chianti Gift Set in Vintages Wooden Box
description: Chianti is where Sangiovese was born and where it is at its best. Discover three expressions of Chianti with this sophisticated gift pack from three of the top-selling producers. When just one won't do, this collection of Tuscan wine is presented in a wooden VINTAGES box, sure to please the red wine lovers on your list.

name: Red Wine Tasting Gift Set in Vintages Wooden Box
description: A little Old World, a little New World, all in one pack. This selection of classic grapes and styles from around the world is the perfect choice when you cannot choose. This fine collection of wines in a VINTAGES wooden crate is an excellent selection for a true discovery on how terroir and grape variety influence wine.

name: Vale de Touros Vinhas Velhas Reserva Red Wine 2019
description: This wine is 100% Castelão, which is a grape variety known for producing big, structured wines. The fruit is grown on vines aged 50+ years in the Palmela region of the Setúbal Peninsula of Portugal, immediately across the Tejo Estuary from Lisbon. Bursting with jammy strawberry, currants and plum along with mocha and baking spices, this wine will pair nicely with grilled sirloin steaks.

name: Lively Peach Cherry Rosé Flavoured Wine Beverage
description: This premium crafted refreshment is made with Canadian sparkling rosé wine and real fruit flavours of juicy peach, tart cherry and a hint of elderflower and mineral. Delicate bubbles and juicy fresh fruit on the palate lead to a crisp and refreshing finish. Serve chilled, over ice, or in elevated cocktails.

name: Rocca delle Macie 8-Bottle Wine and Entertainment Gift Card Bundle
description: Founded by filmmaker and winemaker Italo Zingarelli, the Rocca delle Macìe winery is known for its award-winning Tuscan reds. Crowd-pleasing and food-friendly, buy 4 bottles each of its Chianti Classico, with red fruit and chestnut notes, and its more savoury, oak-aged Chianti Reserva, and get a $25 Cineplex gift card. Total value: $176.60.

name: Yerevan Areni Karmrahyut Winemaker's Blend Red Dry Aragatsotn 2022
description: Ruby red colour. Made with native Armenian grape varietals, this fresh and fruity wine pours with delicate aromas of dark cherry, raspberry, spice and nutty nuances. Juicy and fresh on the palate it shows nice balance and good length on the finish. Enjoy it with your favourite charcuterie and cheese.

name: Rtvelisi Kisi White Dry Wine 2021
description: The Kakheti region has seen winemaking take place for thousands of years. The area features Georgia's red, sandy, calcareous clay 'cinnamomic' soils. These soils are known to encourage great depth of fruit flavour and impart a definitive mineral complexity to the wines. This one is floral, fresh and creamy, with mango, peach and pineapple notes alongside bright, fresh acidity. Pair with fish.

name: Kechris Roza Retsina Wine
description: This retsina wine is made with Xinomavro grapes and fresh resin extracts, bottled unfiltered and aged for 5 years. Clear refreshing notes of pine resin, mastic and herbs mingle with the smoked barrel notes. The generous acidity adds freshness to the palate with a complex mouthfeel and spicy finish. Serve with lamb.

name: Peninsula Ridge Tiny Bubbles Sparkling Wine VQA
description: Tiny Bubbles is produced with selected grapes using the Charmat Method. The aromas are elegant and fresh with bright floral notes, hints of apple, pear and a light minerality. Fresh with lively effervescence this light-bodied, medium-dry bubbly is perfect paired with appetizers, sushi, spicy chicken and fresh berries.

name: Wine Art Xinomavro 2019
description: This complex Xinomavro is aged in a mix of new and seasoned French oak for twelve months. The nose shows red berry, cherry and leather with hints of earth and truffle. The palate is full-bodied with intense, grippy tannins. Flavours of earth, leather and dried fruit dominate the concentrated palate.

name: Infinito Winemaker's Selection Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
description: A juicy red with plenty of spiced berries, strawberries and a fresh leafy accent. Textured and juicy on the palate with a medium body and tight but silky tannins. Some tangy white pepper in the finish. Drink now. Score - 90. (Zekun Shuai, jamessuckling.com, April 4, 2023)

name: Stratus Field Blend Ancestral Sparkling Wine 2022
description: This is a wine that was envisioned by Stoyka after a trip with other winemakers to Italy, where field blends are part of the winemaking tradition. Stoyka wanted to gather up a variety of grapes from the estate, pick them all at once, press them and vinify using the oldest sparkling method in the world, predating the methode traditionelle, a naturally paused fermentation that restarts in spring to complete the 'bubbly' effect in the bottle. This is finished in a crown cap and left undisgorged while the lees remain in bottle and contribute texture and an intriguing hazy hue. The three grapes - Riesling, Chardonnay, and Sauvignon Blanc - need to be separated before joining together because VQA does not allow unidentified 'field blends,' and therefore each variety needs to be weighed and the information sent to the authority for approval. So, a lot of work for such a fun and simple, lightly effervescent bubbly wine. There is nothing funky about this, it's fresh, bright, enticing and intriguing with a lovely nose of bright lemon, white peach, nectarine, kiwi, and passionfruit. It's absolutely delicious on the palate, so bright and cheery with a soft, tickling bubble and firm vein of acidity on the finessed finish tying all those flavours above into a neat little bow. At 11% abv, flip the cap and pour in whatever glass you have handy and enjoy! Score - 92. (Rick VanSickle, winesinniagara.com, May 16, 2023)

name: Koncho Winery Alazanis Valley White 2020
description: The Kakheti region of Georgia has been crafting wine forever, with some reports finding wines dating back to 2000 BCE. The spirit of these traditions is alive with this semi-sweet white made from the Rkatsiteli grape, showcasing flavours of dried mango, lychee, orange peel and fennel.

name: Projection Winemaker's Cut Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
description: This Cabernet Sauvignon includes 15% Petite Sirah and was aged for 10 months in a combination of new and used oak. It has an undeniably approachable disposition without losing any of the boldness and complexity one wants from a California Cabernet. Look for generous cassis, plum and black cherry with spice, touches of vanilla, and a deftly integrated smoky oak.

name: Henry of Pelham Sparkling Wine VQA
description: The Henry of Pelham Sparkling Wine is crafted with high-quality grapes using the Charmat method. Aromas of peach and pear resonate on the fresh and fruity palate, balanced flavours with pleasant effervescence. Made to celebrate every day of the week, pair with smoked salmon, rich cheeses, or buttery popcorn.

name: Aslanis Family Winery Malagouzia 202
description: The Malagouzia grapes are cold-soaked with skin contact, imparting a light golden hue. The aromas express generous citrus fruit notes with peach, pear, white blossom and a hint of minerality. The palate shows white blossom and citrus fruit with pleasant acidity and a refreshing finish. It pairs well with Moussaka.

name: Aslanis Family Winery Assyrtiko 2022
description: This crisp and refreshing Assyrtiko is aged on its lees and is matured in French oak barrels for three months. The aromas reveal zesty citrus fruit with bergamot, honey and vanilla notes. The palate is crisp, with lively acidity and good mineral notes. Enjoy it paired with grilled fish, lamb and Greek tomato salad.

name: Seven Numbers Traditional Brut Sparkling Wine
description: This award-winning sparkling wine is produced using the Traditional Method with Pinot Noir, Chardonnay and Furmint. It is matured for 50 months, resulting in a gentle mousse with notes of apple, citrus fruit and toasty brioche. The palate is creamy with fine bubbles and a long finish. It pairs well with smoked salmon.

name: Vaeni En Lefko Malagouzia Xinomavro White Wine 2023
description: This unique white blend uses a combination of Malagouzia and Xinomavro grapes. The bouquet shows floral aromas with citrus fruit notes, pineapple and peach.  The palate is crisp and refreshing with moderate acidity, good fruit follow-through, and a lengthy finish. Pair it with white meat, fish and seafood.

name: Vaeni Damaskinos Xinomavro Red Wine 2019
description: Damascenos is made from high-quality Xinomavro grapes grown in the Naoussa region. This complex and robust red reveals aromas of dry red fruits, olive and chocolate, highlighted by cinnamon, vanilla and wood notes. The palate is rich and flavourful, with balanced acidity and well-structured tannins. Pair with roast lamb.

name: Nct Winery Riesling 2005
description: Colour: pale straw, lime tint. Nose: minerally, spicy, mint leaf, lime. Taste: off-dry, lime, peach flavours - unusual for Riesling but intriguing; good length. Drinkability: now - 2009. (Tony Aspler, winerytohome.com, Oct. 2006)

name: Nederburg The Winemasters Chardonnay 2022
description: Bright and vivacious with lush honeyed apples and a clean citrus crush lifted by steely acidity, with charming creamy cashew notes at the end.  Score - 95. (Olivia Mason, decanter.com, May 1, 2024)

name: Sparkling Wines 10 bottles + FREE $35 restaurant gift card
description: Add some sparkle to the season. Buy 10 assorted bottles of festive, food-friendly Ontario bubbly (2 x Jackson-Triggs Sparkling Reserve, 2 x Saintly Sparkling Rosé and Sparkling Brut, 2 x Bask Lightly Sparkling Rosé, plus 2 x Kew Vineyards Organic Riesling Sparkling), and get a $35 gift card to Moxie's restaurants.

name: Imperial Fortified Wine
description: Medium amber colour; aromas of dried pears, walnuts, herbs and fruit cake; sweet and creamy along with flavours of sugared plums.

name: Man Family Wines Skaapveld Shiraz 2023
description: 'Skaapveld' refers to the grazing land for sheep that adjoins many Syrah vineyards in the Cape Coast region. This silky-smooth Syrah shows rich dark fruit, dark chocolate, earth, and a touch of black pepper spice. It has the structure and balance to drink to 2028 or beyond, and alternatively, will delight tonight with beef fajitas or burgers.

name: Ghost Pines Winemaker's Blend Cabernet Sauvignon 2020
description: In true California style, this wine blends fruit from Sonoma, Lake County and Napa County to effortlessly balance bold red and blue fruit flavours with notes of smoky vanilla, dark chocolate, and hints of spices. A real crowd-pleaser red that will always be a hit with tourtière or beef stew.

name: Pelee Island Winery Late Harvest Riesling 2021
description: As the name implies, 'Late Harvest' means grapes are picked later in the year, allowing them to dry out slightly on the vine, concentrating their sugars and resulting in a richer, sweeter wine. This 100% Riesling was harvested before the frost set in, making for a well-balanced wine with bracing acidity and a kiss of sweetness. Pair with a spicy jambalaya or jalapeno poppers.

name: Stags' Leap Winery The Leap Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
description: Aromas of ripe blackcurrants, blackberries, licorice, cloves and tobacco. Hints of crushed stones and nut shells, too. Firm and chewy with full body and layers of fine, velvety tannins. Compact and muscular with an array of spiced, mellow fruit and a chocolatey finish. Needs some time to soften more. Try after 2024. [Drink till 2038+.] Score - 96. (jamessuckling.com, March 3, 2022)

name: Esk Valley Winemakers Reserve Chardonnay 2018
description: An elegant and creamy textured Chardonnay which displays complex flavours of white peach, grapefruit, flint and nuts with a long mineral finish. Made with a 'hands-off' approach it is age-worthy and exhibits the land in which it was grown.

name: Inniskillin Winemaker's Select Vineyards Pinot Noir 2010
description: Medium ruby colour with a hint of garnet. Sour cherry, bramble and wild raspberry aromas accented by woodsmoke. Medium bodied, fleshy and concentrated Pinot that retains its elegance. Delicious, subtly smoky finish. Pair with seared tuna steaks, or venison chops in a red wine sauce. (Vintages panel, Nov. 2012)

name: Shea Wine Cellars Estate Pinot Noir 2018
description: All the Shea wines are sourced from the estate, one of the most desirable vineyards in Oregon. This entry-level bottle shows why. The mix of blackberry, black cherry, cola, cocoa and clean earth is perfectly balanced and integrated. Aged in roughly half new French oak, it is a fine expression of both site and vintage. It is already drinking well and should continue to improve over the next decade or longer. Editors' Choice. Score - 93. (Paul Gregutt, Wine Enthusiast, March 1, 2022)

name: Kourtaki Mavrodaphne Of Patras Sweet Red Wine
description: Available at select VINTAGES locations.

name: White House Wine Co. Riesling Pinot Grigio VQA
description: The House Wine Company focuses on creating food-friendly and affordable wines equally suited for Saturday night soirees and Monday night leftovers. This off-dry white shows aromas and flavours of pear and fig, with complementary notes of herb and spice. Try pairing it with butter chicken or pork ramen.

name: Red House Wine Co. Cabernet Shiraz VQA
description: Vibrant medium purple; lifted, smoky and prune aromas with a touch of cedar and coffee beans; dry and medium bodied, with full fruit flavour and smooth tannins on a long finish.

name: Pelee Island Winery J. S. Hamilton Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris 2017
description: This late-harvest pinot gris leaps from the glass with aromas of rosewater, exotic incense and citrus. It bathes the palate with lemon drop candy and lemon zest intertwined with sprigs of herbs and mineral notes. This is medium bodied with good texture and a drying finish and aftertaste. Delightful on its own as an aperitif that will get the gastric juices going, it also pours particularly well with scallops pan-seared in butter and placed over a bed of olive-oiled arugula. Drink or cellar. Exceptional Value!

name: Ghost Pines Winemaker's Blend Zinfandel 2018
description: This is a big, showy, generous Zinfandel with impressive red and black berry, cocoa, vanilla and pepper spice. Supple and long with excellent concentration, it's a wine for grilled ribs or a roast beef dinner.

name: Red House Wine Co. Baco Cabernet Sauvignon VQA
description: Medium deep ruby red colour; pungent aromas of prune, spice, vanilla and herbs with earthy, leafy, toasty notes; dry, medium bodied, with a sweet fruit center, moderate acidity, soft medium tannins and flavours of juicy, sweet plum fruit; hints of spice and vanilla on the finish.

name: Gurjaani Wine Cellar Napareuli 2019
description: The taste of wine is complex; acidity level is medium; the taste is full of tannin and tanning substances that makes wine taste mellow. The wine is wonderful with ham, barbeque, boiled beef, and cheese.
